etymology.description: 小 ‘small/young’ + 妹妹 (reduplicated ‘妹’) = little sister; young girl.
etymology.interpretation: Used as a kinship term for one’s younger sister, and also as an affectionate or polite way to refer to a young girl. Reduplication in 妹妹 softens the tone, while 小 highlights youth or endearment.

parts.english: younger sister; young girl; junior female; girl (as suffix)
younger sister; young girl; junior female; girl (as suffix)

examples.chinese: 我的小妹妹今年八岁(我的小妹妹今年八歲)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de xiǎo mèimei jīnnián bā suì.
examples.english: My little sister is eight years old this year.

examples.chinese: 等车时(等車時)，他把座位让给了小妹妹(他把座位讓給了小妹妹)。
examples.pinyin: Děng chē shí, tā bǎ zuòwèi ràng gěi le xiǎo mèimei.
examples.english: While waiting for the bus, he gave his seat to the young girl.

examples.chinese: 我给小妹妹买了一本图画书(我給小妹妹買了一本圖畫書)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ gěi xiǎo mèimei mǎi le yì běn túhuà shū.
examples.english: I bought a picture book for my little sister.
